# Slovaks in the United Kingdom

Slovak-born residents in the United Kingdom: ??? (2021/22 Census): 71,803 (2021): ??? (2022): 1,219 (2021)Northern Ireland: ??? (2021)
|popplace = Derby, Sheffield, Bradford, Rotherham
|langs    = Majority:English, Slovak
Minority:Romani, Czech

|related-c = Czechs in the United Kingdom
}}
Slovaks in the United Kingdom are those born or raised in the UK, or residents, who are of ethnically Slovak descent or originate from Slovak, a country in Central Europe.
History, population and settlement
Slovaks started coming here in 2004, when they joined the EU. They settled in suburbs of cities and towns such as Normanton, Derby, Page Hall in Sheffield, Ferham and Eastwood in Rotherham, Cliftonville in Margate and many more.
